description: Red is just a normal kid living in the rural Pallet Town, when he decides to go out on his own adventure, along with his rival since childhood, Green. In this world of Pokemon, he makes many friends, humans and Pokemon alike. However, all is not well. Team Rocket is trying to capture Mew, a very rare Pokemon, and is performing experiments on other Pokemon, trying to increase their power. Red and his friends must battle against Team Rocket to stop their cruel experiments and unlock the secrets of Pokemon.
synonyms: โปเกมอน สเปเชียล

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Criminal Organization
tags.description: Prominently features a group of people who commit crimes for illicit or violent purposes.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Creature Taming
tags.description: Features the taming of animals, monsters, or other creatures.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Kids
tags.description: Target demographic is young children.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Estranged Family
tags.description: At least one family member of the MC intentionally distances themselves or a family distances themselves from a person related to the MC.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/k_hidenori_)

Hidenori Kusaka (Japanese: 日下秀憲 Kusaka Hidenori) is the author of the popular Pokémon Adventures manga.    

Hidenori Kusaka became successful with the Pokémon Adventures manga about the time it was released. It was immediately decided that English countries such as America should read this comic. Unlike The Electric Tale of Pikachu, there have been few alterations to the artwork to bring it to Western audiences. The manga has become famous in the United States and is one of the most widely known and translated Pokémon manga series worldwide.    

In 2000, Mato caught a disease making her hand weak. She now couldn't illustrate for the manga due to her disease. Kusaka was afraid that this could jeopardize the manga and it would have to withdraw. However, he met a new illustrator, Satoshi Yamamoto, who was willing to illustrate for the future volumes.    

Recently, Kusaka acted as an advisor for Miho Asada's manga Phantom Thief Pokémon 7, coming up with the name for the manga and the name of main character Hiori.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/matobook2016) | [Website](http://www1.odn.ne.jp/ginta/mato/)

Mato is a Japanese manga illustrator. She illustrated the first nine volumes of the Pokémon Adventures manga

Pascal Oost worked as an editor and scriptwriter for Donald Duck weekly in the 1980s and 1990s. He became a freelancer after the birth of his daughter and since then he has worked as a freelance scriptwriter and translator.
